name: 2-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoic acid
Reason: 2-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoic acid has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components: (1) The basic unit for comparison is benzoic acid, which has a melting point of 120°C. (2) The methoxy group (–O–) adds approximately +5°C due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. (3) The hydroxyl group (–OH) can contribute around +10°C due to hydrogen bonding and increased molecular weight. (4) The carbonyl group (C=O) can add approximately +20°C due to the presence of a carbonyl group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and form a rigid structure.
